SENT.plain: Several authors have reported a link between childhood stroke and inherited thrombophilia in recent years

The impact of such a relationship on management and outcome is yet to be determined, as is the potential cost-benefit ratio associated with the performance of thrombophilic screening in children presenting with ischemic stroke
We present a case that highlights the need for clinical and radiologic examinations to remain the definitive criteria used to diagnose stroke in children
The diagnosis should not be influenced by the finding of a thrombophilic marker
